definitions.text: a writ from a court commanding police to perform specified acts
a type of security issued by a corporation (usually together with a bond or preferred stock) that gives the holder the right to purchase a certain amount of common stock at a stated price
examples: as a sweetener they offered warrants along with the fixed-income securities
a Democrat usually gets the union's endorsement

definitions.text: a written assurance that some product or service will be provided or will meet certain specifications
show to be reasonable or provide adequate ground for
examples: The emergency does not warrant all of us buying guns

definitions.text: stand behind and guarantee the quality, accuracy, or condition of
examples: The dealer warrants all the cars he sells
